content:
• Wednesday, January 2, 2019
  • BRK.B

    Apple’s after-hours drop costs Berkshire ~$2.8B

    • Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK.B) -1.6% after-hours following Apple's Q1 guidance cut, which blamed a range of factors including a weakening economy in China and lower than expected iPhone revenue.
    • Warren Buffett's firm owns 252.5M AAPL shares, which closed today at $157.92/share, valuing its position at $39.87B; the ~7% after-hours drop in AAPL would bring BRK’s holdings to $37.1B and a possible overnight loss of $2.77B.
    • AAPL is BRK’s largest holding and makes up ~21% of its portfolio.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:53 PM | 101 Comments

  • Flash crash in dollar/yen

    • The dollar minutes ago tumbled to ¥106.67 from above ¥109 a few trades earlier. It's since bounced a hair to ¥107.16. FXY +3.6% after hours
    • Alongside, money poured into U.S. government paper, with the 10-year Treasury yield sliding a few more basis points to 2.61%. TLT +0.7% after hour.
    • Both moves come following Apple's revenue warning which sent its shares and U.S. stock index futures into the red. Apple's currently off 7.5% and the QQQs 2.2%.
    • ETFs: TLT, TBT, TMV, FXY, YCS, TBF, EDV, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, VGLT, OTC:JYN, TLH, UBT, SPTL, YCL, DLBS, VUSTX, TYBS, DLBL-OLD, DJPY, OPER, UJPY
     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM | 28 Comments
  • NBNKF

    AAPL and SWKS among after hour movers

    • Gainers: OTCPK:NBNKF +6.1%. SQQQ +5.1%. TVIX +4.3%. QTT +3.6%.
    • Losers: OTCPK:EOCCY -8.7%. AAPL -6.9%. SWKS -5.8%.TTMI -5.5%. TQQQ -5.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 59 Comments
  • AAPL

    Cook discusses iPhone sales, Services forecast

    • Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) Tim Cook appears on CNBC to discuss the company's Q1 warning and reiterates that US-China trade tensions played a role.
    • Cook: “There are a lot of things we can do to turn our business around, both in China and more generally.”
    • Cook says he isn't discussing iPhone unit sales due to the wide range of pricing, but that doesn't mean Apple won't comment on unit sales again. Note that the company announced plans to end unit sales reporting during the last quarterly report.
    • Services revenue is forecasted at over $10.8B for Q1.
    • Asked about the company's product lineup, which still doesn't include the AirPower wireless charging pad, Cook says the company releases things "when they're ready."
    • Apple shares are down 7.4% aftermarket.
    • Previously: Apple cuts Q1 revenue guidance (Jan. 2)
    • Previously: Suppliers drop on Apple's warning (Jan. 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 249 Comments

  • Stock index futures in the red after Apple warning

    • Citing weaker than hoped iPhone revenue, Apple minutes ago trimmed its fiscal Q1 revenue guidance to $84B vs. Street estimates of $89B-$93B. Shares are down nearly 7% after hours, and dragging a number of Apple suppliers lower.
    • Nasdaq 100 futures are down 1.1%. QQQ -1.6% after hours. S&P 500 (NYSEARCA:SPY) and DJIA (NYSEARCA:DIA) futures are lower by 0.65%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM | 89 Comments
  • IZEA

    IZEA +25% on December contract wins

    • IZEA (NASDAQ:IZEA) announces December contract wins including "a high six-figure influencer and content marketing services contract for a subsidiary of a Fortune 10 company."
    • Other new six-figure clients include a large grocery chain, an international restaurant chain, a Fortune 500 electronics manufacturer, and a Fortune 500 apparel company.
    • IZEA will report Q4 bookings on January 7.
    • IZEA shares are up 25% aftermarket to $1.30.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • SWKS

    Suppliers drop on Apple's warning

    • The tech sector (NYSEARCA:XLK) plunges 2.3% aftermarket following Apple's Q1 revenue warning.
    • Apple suppliers on the move include Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS) -4.4%, Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO) -4.7%, Lumentum (NASDAQ:LITE) -2.9%, Qorvo (NASDAQ:QRVO) -5.2%, and TSMC (NYSE:TSM) -2.1%.
    • Previously: Apple cuts Q1 revenue guidance (Jan. 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 31 Comments
  • GNMX

    Aevi Genomic's AEVI-001 flunks mid-stage ADHD study

    • A Phase 2 clinical trial, ASCEND, evaluating Aevi Genomic Medicine's (NASDAQ:GNMX) lead candidate AEVI-001 in children aged 6 - 17 with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) failed to achieve the primary in either Part A or Part B after six weeks of treatment.
    • The company plans to downsize in order to extend its cash runway. At the end of December 2018, it had ~$5M in net working capital.
    • Previously: Aevi Genomic's lead product candidate flunks ADHD study; shares plummet 56% (March 20, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple cuts Q1 revenue guidance

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) cuts its Q1 revenue guidance to $84B (was: $89B to $93B) and expects 38% gross margin and $8.7B in operating expenses.
    • In a letter to investors, Tim Cook attributes all of the revenue shortfall to lower than anticipated iPhone revenue, particularly in China. Cook blames the macro backdrop and weaker than expected iPhone upgrades.
    • Apple shares were halted ahead of the news.
    • Update: Apple shares resume trading at 4:50 PM down 6%.
    • Previously: Apple down 7% on soft guidance (Nov. 1, 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 515 Comments
  • CFRX

    Small med firms see increased buying

    • A number of small cap healthcare firms enjoyed a spike in buying today as investors take advantage of the recent selloff.
    • Selected tickers: (CFRX +15%)(CBLI +22.8%)(CDTX +14.9%)(CLDX +23.6%)(CAPR +20.7%)(CLBS +14.6%)(CTIC +26.7%)(BLRX +14.3%)(AVEO +14.4%)(OTC:ARDM +15.6%)(OTC:ANTH +66.5%)(OTC:ACUR +21.4%)(BMRA +14.1%)(BIOC +13.9%)(ONTX +15.2%)(OHRP +27.9%)(NYMX +19.8%)(NNVC +12.6%)(NBRV +15.1%)(MTP +22.3%)(IDRA +27.1%)(CRIS +19%)(CRVS +16.3%)(ZYNE +25.3%)(TRVN +26.9%)(SGYP +93.2%)(RARX +20.3%)(PRTO +8.4%)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 24 Comments
  • HSGX

    Histogenics up 38%

    • Nano cap Histogenics (HSGX +38.1%) is up on triple normal volume as bargain hunters move in. Shares plummeted several weeks ago when the company announced that it was suspending development of NeoCart after the FDA requested another clinical trial to support a marketing application. Shares had dropped over 80% since then before today's action.
    • On the working capital front, at the end of September 2018 it had $5.2M in cash and equivalents while operations consumed $8.8M during the first three quarters of the year. In Q4, it raised ~$15.9M via a public equity offering and an at-the-market stock sales agreement.
    • The company is currently trading well below its cash value.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • ITUB

    Brazil stocks, real gain in first session after Bolsonaro takes office

    • Brazil's real climbs 2.4% against the U.S. dollar, the Bovespa stock index jumps 3.6% in the first trading session after Jair Bolsonaro takes office as the country's president.
    • Brazil's new economy minister, sworn in on Wednesday, says he'll focus on slashing government pension spending, selling state assets, simplifying a complex tax system.
    • "Our business class is chained down by interest rates, high taxes and labor costs," said the new economy minister, Paulo Guedes, a graduate of the University of Chicago.
    • The ideal tax burden should be about 20% of gross domestic product instead of the current 36% rate, he said.
    • Brazil banks trading in the U.S. advance--Itau Unibanco Holding (ITUB +6.1%), Banco Santander Brasil (BSBR +8.8%), and Banco Bradesco (BBD +7.4%).
    • Related ADRs:Related Stocks: VALE, PBR, CIG, ABEV, GGB, ITUB, OIBR.C, OTCPK:OIBRQ, ERJ, SID, BBD, SGH, GOL, VIV
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 7 Comments
  • ARNC

    Bloomberg: Apollo aiming for Arconic deal by mid-January

    • Arconic (ARNC +9.8%) surges after Bloomberg reports a going-private transaction with Apollo Global Management (APO +0.8%) at $22/share could be completed by mid-January.
    • The companies are negotiating a transaction that would protect APO from ARNC’s possible liability tied to last year's deadly Grenfell Tower fire in London, according to the report.
    • Elliott Management reportedly would buy a majority interest in ARNC's cladding business - the entity that made the aluminum panels used on the Grenfell Tower - which would be recapitalized and insured as part of the spinoff; separately, Elliott would roll over its 10.7% stake in ARNC as part of the take-private deal with APO.
    • Earlier: Apollo's $20B Arconic bid said to be held up on credit woes - NY Post (Dec. 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 68 Comments
  • BMI

    Maxim's best industrial ideas: Badger Meter, BWX Technologies, Tetra Tech

    • Maxim Group recommends buying industrial stocks that it expects will increase dividends by more than 10% in 2019, including the firm's three favorites, Badger Meter (BMI -0.6%), BWX Technologies (BWXT +1.4%) and Tetra Tech (TTEK -2.1%).
    • Together with Buy-rated NV5 Global (NVEE +0.3%), Maxim believes BMI, BWXT and TTEK can continue to improve earnings even amid slower economic growth or a U.S. recession based in part on multi-year orders from the U.S. federal government and orders from utilities and state and local government agencies.
    • The firm thinks the ongoing transformation of the global electrical grid should continue to create job opportunities for many industrials, including CECO Environmental (CECE +1.6%) and NVEE.
    • Also, Maxim believes a lack of positive catalysts for the general market at the beginning of 2019 will spark investor interest in companies that already reduced near-term EPS growth expectations and/or issued initial 2019 guidance, such as BWXT and TTEK.
    • Source: Briefing.com
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • JAGX

    Jaguar Health up 16% ahead of Q4 report

    • Nano cap Jaguar Health (JAGX +15.8%) is up on below-average volume ahead of its Q4 2018 conference call on Monday, January 7, at 8:00 am ET.
    • Net Mytesi sales were up 154% in Q3 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • IPDN

    Microcaps mostly among tech movers

    • Gainers: Professional Diversity Network (NASDAQ:IPDN) +49%. Windstream Holdings (NASDAQ:WIN) +27%. BSQUARE Corporation (NASDAQ:BSQR) +21%. FTE Networks (NYSEMKT:FTNW) +18%. Veritone (NASDAQ:VERI) +17%.
    • Losers: Uxin Limited (NASDAQ:UXIN) -19%. Bitauto Holdings (NYSE:BITA) -18%. Travelzoo (NASDAQ:TZOO) -8%. Aethlon Medical (NASDAQ:AEMD) -7%. MongoDB (NASDAQ:MDB) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • BW

    Babcock & Wilcox expects turnover of European renewable projects in Q1-Q2

    • Babcock & Wilcox (BW +25.5%) jumps after updating the status and expected turnover and transition to ongoing maintenance of four European renewable energy projects it previously said would be handed over to customers by year-end 2018.
    • B&W says the projects are now operational and in various stages of performance and reliability testing, and anticipates turnover will occur at various times during Q1 and Q2 2019.
    • B&W also says it is evaluating further cost reductions in addition to the previously announced cost improvements, and sees "a pathway to reach run-rate EBITDA levels ~$100M within the company’s respective core businesses in the future."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 10 Comments
  • NBL

    Oil tanks explode at Noble Energy Permian well

    • Three oil tanks are still burning at a Noble Energy (NBL +3%) well site in West Texas' Permian Basin following an explosion overnight; no one was injured.
    • NBL says it is isolating the wells that feed into the nearby pipeline systems to ensure the integrity of the oil-gathering pipelines.
    • The company plans to conduct an investigation to determine the cause of the fire.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • GLOB

    Globant -3% on Argentina content services tax

    • Globant (NYSE:GLOB) drops 3% after Argentina enacts a 12% content services tax until 2020.
    • Argentina-based Globant has clients for its software solutions throughout North America and Europe.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • SHLDQ

    REITs with Sears exposure jump as ESL puts forth alternative proposal

    • REITs with exposure to Sears Holdings (OTCPK:SHLDQ +47.1%) jump after the hedge fund run by the retailer's chairman says it's interested in buying Sears's real estate for $1.8B if its offer to buy the company as a going concern fails.
    • CBL & Associates (NYSE:CBL), surges 8.9%, Pennsylvania REIT (NYSE:PEI) gains 3.5%, Washington Prime Group (NYSE:WPG) +3.1%, and Seritage Growth Properties (NYSE:SRG) +1.2%.
    • Eddie Lampert's ESL says it believes its proposal to buy Sears as a going concern will provide the best outcome for creditors and other stakeholders, but puts forth the alternative proposal in case its first offer isn't considered a "qualifying bid".
    • Previously: Reuters: Sears' Lampert weighs bid for assets in bankrutpcy filing (Oct. 11, 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 42 Comments
  • NTGR

    Netgear completes Arlo spin-off

    • Netgear (NASDAQ:NTGR) completes its previously announced distribution of 62.5M shares of Arlo (NYSE:ARLO) common stock, which was about 84% of outstanding shares.
    • Netgear no longer owns any Arlo shares to complete the spin-off.
    • Arlo will join the S&P SmallCap 600 tomorrow before the market opens.
    • NTGR is up 4% and Arlo shares drop 7.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 9 Comments
  • EMES

    Emerge Energy Services and Rosehill Resources among Energy/Materials gainers

    • Gainers: Emerge Energy Services (NYSE:EMES) +32%. Rosehill Resources (NASDAQ:ROSE) +30%. PermRock Royalty Trust (NYSE:PRT) +28%. Sanchez Midstream Partners (NYSEMKT:SNMP) +22%. Blueknight Energy Partners (NASDAQ:BKEP) +22%.
    • Losers: None
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • BRPHD

    Novogratz boosts stake in Galaxy Digital to almost 80%

    • Michael Novogratz, founder and CEO of Galaxy Digital Holdings (OTC:BRPHD), acquires 7.5M ordinary shares in the crypto-focused merchant bank for total proceeds of C$7.4M (US$5.4M).
    • The newly acquired shares represent about 2.7% of Galaxy Digital's issued and outstanding ordinary shares, bringing his stake in the company to almost 80%.
    • Bitcoin +0.9% to $3,914.98 in afternoon trading and Ethereum +7.1% to $152.85.
    • Previously: Novogratz still all-in on crypto - Bloomberg (Dec. 11, 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • MDCA

    WSJ: FrontFour aims to replace three directors at MDC Partners

    • Connecticut hedge fund FrontFour Capital has started a push to replace three directors at advertising firm MDC Partners (MDCA +7.3%), The Wall Street Journal reports.
    • The fund has called for a special meeting to spur the replacements, in a move that follows its longtime pressure for executive changes.
    • FrontFour owns about 5.3% of MDC, which says it's received communication from FrontFour and will "respond in due course."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • COMM

    Bloomberg: CommScope refiled for HSR clearance of Arris deal

    • CommScope (COMM +3%) has refiled for Hart-Scott-Rodino clearance of its deal to buy Arris (ARRS -0.8%), Bloomberg reports.
    • Arris has trimmed some of the day's losses amid that news. Shares were down as mush as 1.6% earlier.
    • That original HSR clearance was set to expire last week; CommScope says the overall deal timing is unaffected and it's still on track to close in the first half.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • UNIT

    Windstream +25% as market reacts to EarthLink sale

    • Windstream is up 25.8%, a top gainer after returning to trading action following Monday afternoon's news of the sale of its EarthLink consumer business for $330M in cash.
    • That's a move that firms up the balance sheet even as the company continues awaiting a decision in its debt-default trial with Aurelius Capital over the Uniti Group (UNIT +1.5%) spin-off. “We will be a more delevered company over time after selling a declining business,” a spokesman says.
    • Volume at midday has already surpassed daily average for Windstream, with more than 980,000 shares changing hands.
    • In upcoming catalysts, Windstream CEO Tony Thomas is speaking at the Citigroup conference next Tuesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 57 Comments
  • FPI

    Farmland Partners leads financial gainers; GWG Holdings and Hexindai among losers

    • Gainers: Farmland Partners (NYSE:FPI) +11%. U.S. Global Investors (NASDAQ:GROW) +9%. Banco Bradesco (NYSE:BBDO) +9%. Banco Santander (NYSE:BSBR) +9%. EverQuote (NASDAQ:EVER) +8%.
    • Losers: Kingsway Financial Services (NYSE:KFS) -13%. Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) -10%. GWG Holdings (NASDAQ:GWGH) -9%. Hexindai (NASDAQ:HX) -9%. CyrusOne (NASDAQ:CONE) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • ESTR

    WIN, BEDU and BITA among notable midday movers

    • Gainers: Estre Ambiental (NASDAQ:ESTR) +48%. Prana Biotechnology (NASDAQ:PRAN) +48%. MedEquities Realty Trust (NYSE:MRT) +44%. Professional Diversity Network (NASDAQ:IPDN) +42%. Rosehill Resources (NASDAQ:ROSE) +33%. China Ceramics (NASDAQ:CCCL) +32%. Emerge Energy Services (NYSE:EMES) +27%. Bright Scholar Education Holdings (NYSE:BEDU) +26%. Leap Therapeutics (NASDAQ:LPTX) +24%. Windstream Holdings (NASDAQ:WIN) +25%.
    • Losers: Bitauto Holdings Limited (NYSE:BITA) -18%. Uxin Limited (NASDAQ:UXIN) -17%. Performant Financial Corporation (NASDAQ:PFMT) -16%. Pingtan Marine Enterprise (NASDAQ:PME) -16%. MyoKardia (NASDAQ:MYOK) -14%. Reebonz Holding Limited (RBZ) -13%. iPic Entertainment (NASDAQ:IPIC) -13%. Kingsway Financial Services (NYSE:KFS) -13%. Cryoport (NASDAQ:CYRX) -11%. Co-Diagnostics (NASDAQ:CODX) -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 3 Comments
  • WYNN

    Macau names rally after strong December results

    • Macau-related casino stocks are making gains after December gross gaming revenue for the casino mecca rolled in ahead of expectations. The strong GGR print is lifting expectations that EBITDA marks in the sector will surprise to the upside.
    • Looking ahead, early forecasts from analysts for 2019 GGR are ranging from +2% to +6%. The estimates are being held back a bit by concerns over tougher comparisons next year, a Chinese economic slowdown and trade war risk.
    • Advancers today include Wynn Resorts (WYNN +6.4%), Las Vegas Sands (LVS +4.3%), Melco Resorts & Entertainment (MLCO +4.2%), MGM Resorts (MGM +4%) and Studio City International (MSC).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 10 Comments
  • GE

    GE pops to the top of S&P 500, +8% to kick off 2019

    • General Electric (GE +7.7%) surges as much as 8% and pushes to the top of the S&P 500 as it kicks off the new year.
    • Bloomberg takes the occasion to offer a reminder that the stock also started last year in fine fashion, riding high among the Dow's leaders in the first week and a half of 2018 after ending 2017 at the bottom of the index.
    • Buyer’s remorse set in shortly thereafter as the rally fizzled and shares sold off steadily, eventually propelling the stock's exit from the Dow en route to a 57% loss for the full year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 44 Comments

  • Stocks erase early losses

    • Just past the noon hour in the year's first session, the S&P 500 and DJIA are only barely in the red, and the Nasdaq has moved into the green. All three had opened roughy 1.5% to the downside.
    • The energy sector is the best performer, led by a spectacular reversal in oil - down 3% earlier, black gold is now higher by more than 4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 13 Comments
  • EBR

    Brazil stocks broadly higher as new president makes moves

    • Brazil stocks enjoy broad gains after new Pres. Bolsonaro is sworn in and issues decrees affecting the economy, agriculture and society, while forging closer political ties with the U.S.
    • Bolsonaro was elected on a platform to clean up Brazilian politics, and he names the country’s top anti-corruption figure, Sergio Moro, in charge of a Justice Ministry beefed up to fight graft and battle organized crime.
    • Among the movers: EBR +19.2%, SID +9.3%, SBS +9.2%, BSBR +8.6%, PBR +7.6%, BBD +7.4%, GGB +6.8%, ABEV +6.6%, CIG +6.4%, UGP +5.9%, ITUB +5.5%, TSU +4.7%, VIV +4.5%, BRFS +4.5%, CZZ +4.5%, ELP +4.5%, CBD +4.2%, ERJ +3.6%, AZUL +2.3%, VALE +1.4%.
    • ETFs: EWZ, BRZU, BZQ, UBR, FBZ
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 19 Comments
  • NFLX

    Netflix confirms it's named Activision's Neumann as CFO

    • Netflix (NFLX -1.6%) has confirmed reports that it's hired Spencer Neumann from Activision Blizzard (ATVI +1.2%) to be its new chief financial officer.
    • Activision had put Neumann on paid leave pending an opportunity for him to demonstrate why the company didn't have cause to terminate his employment as it planned.
    • Netflix was aiming to base its next CFO in Los Angeles, with a focus on production finance. Along with his Activision experience, Neumann had previously held senior positions at Walt Disney, including the roles of CFO and executive VP of Global Guest Experience in its Parks and Resorts division.
    • As for Activision, the change back to former CFO Dennis Durkin "may add another overhang on shares" but "we expect minimal business disruption," Baird says. Durkin's a steady hand which helps make up for an unexpected transition, analyst Colin Sebastian suggests, and he expects a cautious/conservative 2019 outlook even as shares are "embedding an overly negative company and sector view." (h/t Bloomberg)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 10 Comments
  • KKR

    Franklin Square loan fund slides after KKR takes over

    • A $2B loan fund, formerly managed by Blackstone, has seen its market value sink since KKR (KKR -0.2%) took over management of the vehicle in April.
    • The Franklin Square Investment fund--renamed FS-KKR Capital (FSK +4.3%) when KKR took over its management--has written down five large investments since KKR took over, perhaps indicating a more cautious approach than Blackstone's, the Financial Times reports.
    • Business development corporations, in general, have been facing increasing pressures.
    • “Leverage levels are high, spreads are low, and we’ve got more covenant-lite paper coming through," says Keefe, Bruyette & Woods analyst Ryan Lynch.
    • Still, FSK's decline at 29% between April and mid-December is steeper than other BDCs'. Funds run by Ares Management and Golub Capital posted single-digit declines by comparison.
    • Previously: FS Investment and Corporate Capital Trust holders approve merger (Dec. 3, 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 5 Comments
  • GM

    GM hits 200K EVs sold level

    • General Motors (GM +0.2%) passed the 200K cumulative U.S. electric vehicle sales threshold late last year, sources tell Reuters.
    • The development means that the federal tax credit for an EV purchase will fall to $3,750 in April and then drop to $1,875 in October for six months before completely going way in April 2020 unless the rules are revised.
    • Earlier today, Tesla announced a $2K price cut on EVs to adjust for the loss of the tax credit for new buyers.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 17 Comments
  • WATT

    Energous leads consumer gainers; Tesla and Cryoport among losers

    • Gainers: Energous (NASDAQ:WATT) +15%. Arcimoto (NASDAQ:FUV) +12%. Kandi Technologies (NASDAQ:KNDI) +12%. China XD Plastics (NASDAQ:CXDC) +11%. Westport Fuel Systems (NASDAQ:WPRT) +9%.
    • Losers: Pingtan Marine Enterprise (NASDAQ:PME) -15%. Cryoport (NASDAQ:CYRX) -11%. Kewaunee Scientific (NASDAQ:KEQU) -7%. Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 3 Comments
  • HSIC

    Baird softens view on Henry Schein; shares slip 3%

    • Medical products distributor Henry Schein (HSIC -2.9%) is down on average volume. Shares dropped as low as 5% on the heels of a downgrade at Baird. Analyst Jeff Johnson cut his rating to Neutral and trimmed the price target to $85 (11% upside) citing "rising uncertainties" and "tough comps" in the dental business after a solid 2018.
    • Dental competitors Patterson Companies (PDCO +2.7%) and DENTSPLY SIRONA (XRAY +3.2%) have sidestepped the selling. Mr. Johnson rates both Neutral as well.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • VIA

    Strong New Year's Day pushes 'Aquaman' past $200M at home

    • As it did over the regular weekend, Aquaman (T +2%) ruled the New Year's Day box office with a $16.8M take as major U.S. holidays wrapped up the year.
    • That puts Aquaman over the $200M mark in domestic grosses, and nears $800M for a cumulative global take.
    • For its part, Mary Poppins Returns (DIS -1.4%) topped $115M in cumulative domestic gross, and Bumblebee (VIA +3.9%, VIAB +3.4%) drew about $7M on New Year's Day to reach a domestic total to date of $78.5M.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 16 Comments
  • HAIN

    Hain Celestial perky after founder's CNBC appearance

    • Hain Celestial (NASDAQ:HAIN) is up 3.0% on what's being attributed to comments made by founder Irwin Simon on CNBC about industry consolidation.
    • Simon expressed confidence that a Hain deal will happen due to the strong assets it holds.
    • CNBC video
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 4 Comments
  • USCR

    U.S. Concrete -6% as D.A. Davidson cuts estimates

    • U.S. Concrete (USCR -6.1%) tumbles as much as 9% as D.A. Davidson analyst Brent Thielman cuts estimates amid difficult market conditions and lowers his stock price target to $70 from $82, although he still rates the shares a Buy.
    • Thielman thinks weather conditions, particularly in Texas, and wildfires in California will result in weaker than expected earnings, and believes near-term results will not be able to ease concerns such as shortfalls in financial results, slowing construction markets and elevated leverage that led to a 58% drop in 2018.
    • The analyst forecasts 2018 adjusted EPS of $2.36 from $2.88 previously on revenues of $1.49B vs. $1.52B and cuts his 2019 outlook to EPS of $3.65 from $4.88 on $1.64B in revenues from $1.69B earlier.
    • Thielman also cuts stock price targets on Eagle Materials (EGLE +2.8%), Martin Marietta (MLM +0.7%) and Summit Materials (SUM +1.9%).
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • SFS

    Smart & Final Stores +11% on low-volume move

  • XOM

    Crude oil rallies, reversing earlier losses

    • Crude oil prices reverse course to turn higher after falling sharply on rising output from major producers and concerns about an economic slowdown; WTI +2.8% to $46.69/bbl, Brent +3.1% to $55.45/bbl.
    • WisdomTree research director Nitseh Shah predicts a possible rebound for Brent crude because of an OPEC-led supply cut that starts this month and moderating U.S. supply growth.
    • “We believe we will see an upward correction,” Shah says. “Recent weakness in prices should slow the growth of U.S. shale production.”
    • OPEC oil output fell by 825K bbl/day in December and is set to drop 870K bbl/day in January, according to consultant JBC Energy.
    • Shares of oil and gas producers are picking up steam: XOM +1.2%, CVX +1.1%, RDS.A +1%, BP +1.5%, COP +0.9%, HES +3%,  MRO +2.5%, APA +3%, DVN +2.3%, PXD +3.4%, EOG +3.5%, CXO +2.8%, CHK +4.1%, SWN +7.5%, RRC +2.5%, EQT +3.5%, CLR +3.6%.

  • BLK

    After a rough year, asset managers' prospects for 2019 not much brighter

    • After a rough 2018, asset managers face just as many challenges this year.
    • Uncertainty over global economic growth and geopolitics last year hurt asset prices and with it asset managers' profits; competition for assets and investors' shift toward index investing also contributed to the decline, the Wall Street Journal reports.
    • Traditional managers are getting squeezed by losing assets and being forced to cut fees, leading to lower revenues. Active managers' share of global industry revenues fell to 41% by the end of 2017 from 64% in 2003 and their share of AUM sank to 52% from 72%, says Boston Consulting Group.
    • As a result, there may be more deals to build scale, such as Invesco's recent acquisition of OppenheimerFunds from MassMutual.
    • Previously: Asset manager stocks retreat as bull market loses steam (Dec. 27, 2018)
    • Related tickers: BLK, BAM, TROW, AB, IVZ, BEN, OZM, AMP, WETF
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 6 Comments

  • SCOR

    CBS ratings contract with Nielsen lapses

    • The new year brings the end of a ratings contract between CBS (CBS +0.2%) and Nielsen (NLSN -1.3%), with no replacement in place or yet in sight, Variety reports.
    • The Tiffany Network has considered replacing ratings from Nielsen with its own numbers and info from comScore (NASDAQ:SCOR), though Nielsen expects CBS will have a rougher time negotiating with advertisers without its ratings.
    • CBS access to Nielsen data has been revoked with its contract lapsed, Variety reports.
    • It's the latest challenge to a household name in ratings amid sea changes in viewing, with firms looking to capture eyeballs as TV embraces streaming and on-demand programming and the growth of rivals like Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime and others. Gray Television (GTN -1.6%) recently said it decided to go with comScore over Nielsen for 2019.

  • GNCA

    Dosing underway in Phase 1/2a study of Genocea's cancer vaccine candidate GEN-009; shares up 22%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Genocea Biosciences (GNCA) is up 22% out of the gate this morning following its announcement that the first patients have been dosed in a Phase 1/2a clinical trial evaluating neoantigen cancer vaccine candidate GEN-009.
    • The study consists of three parts: Part A (nine subjects enrolled) will assess the safety and immunogenicity of GEN-009 alone in cancer patients with no evidence of disease but likely to relapse. Part B will assess GEN-009 combined with checkpoint inhibitors in patients with advanced solid tumors while Part C will enroll patients who have progressed on/after checkpoint inhibitor therapy.
    • According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated completion date is December 2022.

  • TSLA

    Tesla plunges after deliveries update, price cut

    • Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) discloses that Q4 production was 86,555 vehicles.
    • The quarterly tally includes 61,394 Model 3 vehicles, in line with the company's guidance and 15% higher than the Q3 mark. 25,161 Model S and X vehicles were produced, which Tesla says is consistent with the long-term run rate goal of ~100K per year.
    • Tesla says Q4 deliveries came in at 90,700 vehicles, including 63,150 Model 3 (vs. 63.7 consensus estimate), 13,500 Model S, and 14,050 Model X vehicles.
    • For the full year, Tesla delivered a total of 245,240 vehicles, consisting of 145,846 Model 3 vehicles and 99,394 Model S and X vehicles.
    • Tesla says its inventory levels remain the smallest in the automotive industry.
    • On an important final note, Tesla says it's reducing the price of Model S, Model X and Model 3 vehicles in the U.S. by $2K to counterbalance in part the reduction of the EV tax credit.
    • TSLA -7.2% premarket to $309.09.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM | 471 Comments
  • CHK

    WSJ: Chesapeake Energy's oil move looks ill-timed, further straining finances

    • Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) -3.8% pre-market following a WSJ report discussing the company's big investment in oil prior to WTI crude's 40%-plus drop since early October.
    • CEO Doug Lawler tells WSJ that lower oil prices stress a company like CHK, which reported $9.4B in long-term debt at the end of Q3, but he says CHK plans to dedicate at least 80% of 2019 capex to oil production because "quite simply, the margins are far superior to gas."
    • CHK needs to produce more in order to improve cash flow, and its operations in Wyoming's Powder River Basin, where it added a fifth drilling rig last year, will be a test; it costs CHK ~$8M to drill and frack each of its wells in Wyoming, compared with ~$6M per well in the Eagle Ford shale of South Texas, but the company says the extra expense is worth it because the wells are more prolific.
    • CHK says it has fine-tuned its approach such that its Wyoming wells can generate returns at $25-$35/bbl oil, well below the overall Powder River Basin average of $47, but those breakeven prices do not include full corporate overhead or land costs; consulting firm RS Energy says the average all-inclusive breakeven for Powder River is $61/bbl.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM | 16 Comments
